title: [main] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade
body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

[marker]: <> (Begin:Coherency Updates)
## Coherency Updates

The following updates ensure that dependencies with a *CoherentParentDependency*
attribute were produced in a build used as input to the parent dependency's build.
See [Dependency Description Format](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/DependencyDescriptionFormat.md#dependency-description-overview)

[DependencyUpdate]: <> (Begin)

- **Coherency Updates**:
  - **Microsoft.DotNet.XliffTasks**: from 1.0.0-beta.23426.1 to 1.0.0-beta.23475.1 (parent: Microsoft.DotNet.Arcade.Sdk)

[DependencyUpdate]: <> (End)

[marker]: <> (End:Coherency Updates)




[marker]: <> (Begin:fc4faec0-9ee6-43b9-bc7a-08da8607f4c7)

nodes.body: This is not ok, we need to stay on Arcade 8. I think that'll mean that we need to adjust a darc subscription @maridematte.
Does the major arcade update generly need to go only in hand with sdk update?

The most relevant factor is support lifecycle and what .NET versions we're going to ship in. We will be shipping in .NET 8 SDKs (as well as .NET 9-preview SDKs) until .NET 9, so we must not move forward past the .NET 8 toolchain until the release where we won't ship into .NET 8 any more because the next release is .NET SDK 9.0.100.
Not sure we can do this yet, I think it'll break our official builds because they're not on VS 17.8 yet.
Yes.  error NETSDK1213: (NETCORE_ENGINEERING_TELEMETRY=Build) Targeting .NET 8.0 or higher in Visual Studio 2022 17.7 is not supported.

```suggestion
```

This should be able to be folded into the previous pattern match.
